column4: Skippy MP3!  I use Xubuntu and gxine to play MP3s and it skips a lot!
'sudo hdparm /dev/hd*' | grep using_dma' and make sure dma is on on all your disks
but without any of the apostrophes
including the one after the *
surfinkid: Is it an external modem, or a winmodem?
The grep command IS SLOW.
surfnkid: Yeah, what ubotu said is probably your best bet.  I could help with an external modem.
it shouldn't be.  That command took me a good fraction of a second to run
I'm talking Pentium MMX 266mhz 2GB HD 172MB RAM
Okay, but still not more than a few seconds probably
I ctrl+C it it was slow.
Might be worth checking the spelling. sudo hdparm /dev/hd* | grep using_dma
|lastexile| wait
HAve you tried any other players?
I'm using dma and still skips with all CPU activity.
just for fun, use the console to run mplayer on one of the files
Where can I get madplay?
Could be tricky, we're using different kernels.
mplayer?
How do you know?  And where can I get a command line player.
I think it should come with a standard install.  'mplayer filename'
mplayer is not a command
I'm using a kernel compiled for 686, which wouldn't work on your hardware.
Is one installed already?  Where can I download a small command line player?
Do you have spare disk space to play with?
Not vlc, takes long to download.
like 500mb
|lastexile| how to obtain it?
madplay is in the repositories.  'sudo apt-get install madplay'
Thank you!  I needed a precompiled apt-get mp3 player!
You can also use 'sudo apt-get install mplayer' to get mplayer, but it's a 3.5 MB download.
